title.narrative: Assistance for the Development of Afghan Legal Access and Transparency (ADALAT)

description.narrative: (Afghanistan): ADALAT works with the formal and informal justice actors to ensure fair and transparent implementation of the rule of law for all Afghan citizens. ADALAT work's to increase effectiveness and reach of the formal justice sector; strengthen linkages between the formal & traditional justice sectors; and increase citizen demand for quality legal services by increasing citizens' legal awareness and creating clinical legal education programs. FY 2020 resources to build the technical capacity and improve administrative operations of the judiciary, train Afghan legal professionals, improve case management system, improve the informal justice sector decisions, train communities in traditional dispute resolution, and increase awareness among Afghan citizens of their rights under the law. ..FY 2020 resources to strengthen the informal justice system through the Justice Engagement Model implemented by CSO partners. Traditional dispute resolution participants in the informal justice system support community peace and harmony through trusted traditional approaches, thus preventing escalation of tensions as cases work their way through the formal justice system. To addres increase in GBV during the COVID-19 pandemic, ADALAT will implement activities to increase knowledge and awareness of GBV. ADALAT will address the negative impacts of impunity for perpetrators of GBV in both the formal and informal justice systems...ADALAT collaborates with the courts, Ministry of Justice (MOJ), civil society organizations, target universities, and traditional dispute resolution bodies to achieve these objectives. Improving rule of law is a cornerstone of security, democracy, and peace. ..This program also contributes to the USAID Mission's Integrated Country Strategy goal of supporting the Afghan government to become stable, democratic, and responsive to citizens by improving citizen access to justice..... .. ...

Objectives for Afghanistan: ADALAT’s (“justice” in Dari and Pashto) objective is to improve citizen access to justice. ADALAT increases efficiency and integrity in the formal justice system through training and the development of more robust court systems and procedures. At the same time, ADALAT works to create stronger links between the formal and informal justice sectors and greater consistency in the application of Afghan law by traditional dispute resolution actors.Finally, ADALAT seeks to satisfy citizen demand for quality legal services through expanded public legal education, improved legal education, and enhanced legal assistance.
